attributes.action: Give humans a decent meal in hospital
attributes.additional_details:
I had an experience in Royal preston hospital this was it
: I was in  hospital ill from Tuesday 1st December 2020 to 5th December and they said to eat pleanty to get better and drink they said they will give me food this is what they gave me 

An apple with a knife and fork and small orange juice 

Next day a dry potato 

Absolutely appoling this is ridiculous luckily I had family what brought me food but some people will not be as lucky as me this is shocking and I blame boris awful PM being told to eat pleanty and they give me this 

Everyone share this please 🙏
attributes.background: Give humans a human sized meal in hospital

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about food in hospitals, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Government already sets minimum standards for the provision on patient food in hospitals. There has also been a recent review into hospital food, you can find out more here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/new-blueprint-for-better-hospital-food

If you believe that food received in hospital is inadequate, you could make a complaint:
https://www.england.nhs.uk/contact-us/complaint/

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
